rename.from: Windowed full screen window minimized when mouse click on another monitor
rename.to: Windowed full screen window minimizes when mouse click on another monitor

body:
If you set the window hint for GLFW_AUTO_ICONIFY before you create your window, it should fix your problem.

``` c
glfwWindowHint(GLFW_AUTO_ICONFIY, GL_FALSE);
```

GLFW_AUTO_ICONIFY specifies whether the (full screen) window will automatically iconify and restore the previous video mode on input focus loss. This hint is ignored for windowed mode windows.

However I believe what you said is the expected behavior and might I suggest putting a note there in the documentation.

The documentation for `GLFW_AUTO_ICONIFY` says this:

> This hint is ignored for windowed mode windows.

So is a "windowed full screen" window not counted as a "windowed mode" window?
I read this as "Windowed Full screen/Borderless Full screen" for glfw is a full screen mode that doesn't change the monitor's mode (resolution, refresh rate, etc.).

Thanks @bornskilled200 and @elmindreda for the info with auto iconify.
That did solve the issue.
However, once the window loses the focus because of me clicking on another monitor, the Windows Task Bar now gets visible over the GLFW window.
That might be expected behaviour (as it also happens with for example fullscreen YouTube videos on Chrome/HTML5), but is there a way to avoid this?

> `GLFW_FLOATING` specifies whether the window will be floating above other regular windows, also called topmost or always-on-top. This is intended primarily for debugging purposes and cannot be used to implement proper full screen windows. This hint is ignored for full screen windows.

You shouldn't use `GLFW_FLOATING` unless you really want always-on-top behavior for _windows_. That's usually reserved for testing purposes only (quicker turnaround times), not finished products.

If there's something you want to achieve for end result and it's not possible without `GLFW_FLOATING`, then that should be an issue (which might be resolved as repurposing/documenting `GLFW_FLOATING` for both debugging and non-debugging purposes, or another better way).

issue.title: Full screen windows minimizes when mouse click on another monitor
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
In a multi-monitor setup (OS: Windows 10 21H2), ImPlay's windowed full screen minimizes when mouse is clicked on another monitor. This behavior is a bit inconvenient and different from MPV's.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
According to [https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/447](https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/447), fullscreen can remain maximized when it loses focus by setting the Window Attribute `glfwWindowHint(GLFW_AUTO_ICONIFY, GL_FALSE)`
The attribute conflicts with the `ontop` function at windowed mode, so it should only be enabled for fullscreen.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I attempted implementing a fix https://github.com/TauZolver/ImPlay/commit/a970575da09ab03e59b0bafc592b82fa5a5f5e15 that works for my Windows PC, but I do not have machines to test if works for MacOS and Linux platforms.


**Additional context**
Thanks for the amazing work! ImPlay gives motivation for one to want to drop PotPlayer for good.
